thread.section_title: Man City v Man Utd rescheduled for a Thursday night amid fixture chaos – Metro
thread.title: Man City v Man Utd rescheduled for a Thursday night amid fixture chaos
thread.title_full: Man City v Man Utd rescheduled for a Thursday night amid fixture chaos

author: Simon Rice
title: Man City v Man Utd rescheduled for a Thursday night amid fixture chaos
text:
The Etihad will host a rare Thursday night Premier League game (Getty) The Manchester derby at the Etihad Stadium has been rearranged for a Thursday evening, according to reports.
Man City will host Manchester United on April 27 according to the Sun after the original fixture was delayed due to United’s participation in the EFL Cup final.
Luke Shaw returns to Man Utd squad as Jose Mourinho opts for three at the back The decision comes amid Jose Mourinho’s persistent complaints about his side’s fixture congestion.
Both teams will be playing on the Sunday prior – Man City against Arsenal in the FA Cup at 3pm and Manchester United away at Burnley at 2.15pm.
While City have a quick turnaround afterwards with a trip to Middlesbrough on the Saturday at 3pm, Manchester United have an additional day, playing Swansea at Old Trafford on Sunday at 12pm.
Premier League fixtures are rarely scheduled for a Thursday night, which would appear to suggest the decision has been taken to aid the sides as much as possible in terms of recuperation.
Manchester United fixtures Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar
West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
More: Football Joe Hart at fault for both goals in shocking Torino performance

Mourinho stated on Thursday that his side have many ‘enemies’ and before that that those who decide the fixtures ‘don’t give an S’ about his side.
